summary: This document is a sealed application and order from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking a non-disclosure order related to a grand jury subpoena issued to Oath Holdings, Inc. (Yahoo). The subpoena requests records for four email accounts, including 'jeffreyepsteinorg@yahoo.com', as part of an investigation into violations including sex trafficking. The government argues that disclosure of the subpoena could jeopardize the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter to Oath Holdings, Inc., as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Debra Freeman
persons.context: Signs and issues the § 2705(b) Non-Disclosure Order, sealing the application and prohibiting Oath Holdings from notifying subscribers about the subpoena.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena and Non-Disclosure Order
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office obtains a sealed grand jury subpoena and a corresponding non-disclosure order from a magistrate judge, targeting Oath Holdings, Inc. for records related to four specific email accounts.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for Records Production
events.description: The subpoena commands Oath Holdings, Inc. to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records to a Special Agent by this date.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. government served a sealed grand jury subpoena on Oath Holdings, Inc. (Yahoo) on December 19, 2018, seeking extensive records for four email accounts, including 'jeffreyepsteinorg@yahoo.com'.

A federal magistrate judge granted a 365-day non-disclosure order, prohibiting Yahoo from notifying the account subscribers, due to concerns notification could cause flight, evidence tampering, witness intimidation, or jeopardize the investigation.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking) and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The subpoena rider demands comprehensive subscriber data, session logs, payment information, and correspondence for the listed accounts.
The document reveals an active, sealed federal grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and associated conduct as of late 2018, prior to his July 2019 arrest.
